meanings.definition: Belonging to an earlier time; outdated or old-fashioned.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tools found in the cave were quite archaic.
meanings.sent2: Her grandmother's sewing machine seemed archaic compared to the new models.
meanings.sent3: The idea of using carrier pigeons for messaging today would be considered archaic.
meanings.sent4: In the fast-paced world of technology, floppy disks are now archaic relics.
meanings.sent5: The knight's armor looked archaic but held a timeless charm.

meanings.sent1: The rotary phone became archaic with the rise of smartphones.
meanings.sent2: Fax machines are now considered archaic forms of communication.
meanings.sent3: Trying to navigate with a paper map in this age of GPS would be quite archaic.
meanings.sent4: The typewriter is an archaic device in today's digital world.
meanings.sent5: Using a quill pen may seem archaic, but it has its own nostalgic appeal.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a much earlier or primitive period.
meanings.sent1: The cave paintings showed an archaic style of artistry.
meanings.sent2: The tribal dance was performed in an archaic manner to honor tradition.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a loincloth to a modern party would be an archaic fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins revealed archaic architectural techniques.
meanings.sent5: The ritual was conducted in an archaic language to preserve its authenticity.
